column1: * In this review, primary energy comprises commercially traded fuels, including modern renewables used to generate electricity.
Energy from all sources of non-fossil power generation is accounted for on an input-equivalent basis. See the appendix or bp.com/statisticalreview for more details on this methodology.
USSR includes CIS, Georgia, Ukraine and the Baltic States.
# Excludes Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania prior to 1985 and Slovenia prior to 1990.
